website_summaries.verdict: The Asics Gel Quantum Infinity is a stylish-looking running shoe that provides the right amount of cushioning suited for all types of daily activities.  May it be for vigorous runs or just taking a leisurely walk, this well-engineered shoe did not disappoint the users in providing a high level of comfort and stability when they are on the move. Although the shoe’s weight and breathability is something that needs to be improved according to some testers, it does not diminish the fact that the Asics Gel Quantum Infinity is a shoe that needs to be added in a neutral runner’s shoe arsenal.
pros: The Gel Quantum Infinity is the first shoe from Asics to feature a visible full-length Gel technology midsole from heel to toe giving the shoe incredible comfort and flexibility
Most of the users are pleased on how comfortable the cushioning on the new Asics Gel Quantum Infinity is saying it gives it a “pillow-soft” feel
Some runners applauded the fact the shoe is very lightweight
Also liked by a few users is that the shoe fits snugly with an ample room in the toe-box
It had been mentioned in some reviews that the shoe fits well even on users with wide feet
cons: One of the testers said that his feet felt a little warm towards the end of the run
A few reviews said that the shoe does not provide a substantial amount of energy return, especially when compared to running shoes like the Adidas Ultra Boost
Also noted by a user is that the Gel Quantum Infinity is quite heavier than many running shoes of a similar type

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky and uncomfortable tongue
customer_reviews.text: Overall the shoe is comfortable and fits well, but it has two major flaws that caused me to send it back. The type of rubber used on the sole is super squeaky when walking on certain types of floors like hardwood. Also, the tongue is a strangely shaped piece of leather with no cushion which digs into your leg while you're walking. Not sure who thought that was a good design, but they must not have tested it out on enough people I couldn't walk more than a few paces without it feeling uncomfortable, not sure how anyone could stand to run long distances in these things. Back they go.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Hirt

customer_reviews.title: Not enough padding
customer_reviews.text: Not well padded. the gel on the sole is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: G. Von Herzen

customer_reviews.title: Novelty experience
customer_reviews.text: Over all feels premium with features such as gel bottoms, gold aglets, and a unique tongue. However the show is much heavier than a normal Asics shoe. My pair had some imperfections in the gel layer as well. The tongue is less comfortable than a standard Asics shoe but it does stay in place throughout the day. Lastly the range of materials makes the shoe hard to clean and protect from dirt and debris.
customer_reviews.author: Steve b.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but poorly assembled.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best designed ASICS if have seen so far, very cool. Great fit on the right foot. Left foot was assembled wrongly: Sole seemed to be one size smaller than upper part, caused a way too small toe box. Returned product.
customer_reviews.author: BeX

customer_reviews.title: Love em
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. It's my second pair! Super comfy and great style to them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martinson

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair I bought. Engineered in Japan, this is a technical shoe and it is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Qbert5150

customer_reviews.title: ASICS Men's Gel-Quantum Infinity Running Shoes three weeks of use and so for ok
customer_reviews.text: arch slightly higher than other 360 models and slightly wider I had to wear a heavier sock, but that is ok. I have an instep that bruises easily, but for this model it was not necessary to modify the way i tie my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Leon S.

customer_reviews.title: Walking shoe, lifting shoe, no running
customer_reviews.text: Heavier, not enough gel at the heel, no arch support, good comfortable walking and lifting weights, looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Andrae

customer_reviews.title: compfortable to walk with
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the lasse that is untied by itself everyone and while, which causes inconvenience
customer_reviews.author: Fahim Kazim

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. They are a little heavier than your normal running shoe but you can’t tell when you’re wearing them. Feel like I’m walking on clouds. Trying to talk my wife into a pair of the Gel-Quantum Infinity 1 or 2. She doesn’t really like the looks, but if she tried them, especially with her achy feet, I think she would love them. To be continued...
customer_reviews.author: BoutaKovf

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable at other Asics shoes
customer_reviews.text: This shoe, although more expensive than others I've owned, was not as comfortable. Not the same amount of cushioning or stability.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Amazing feel to this shoe. The sole is solid gel, so expect just a bit more weight than compared to a foam/gel sole. The sizes are true to the suggestions via the sizing chart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable lifting shoe
customer_reviews.text: Me: I run 40 miles a week and lift 4x per week. Shoes: They are marketed for running but are much more suited toward lifting/CrossFit style workouts. In the distance running world, these are extremely heavy compared to most other options for DISTANCE running. If you are a gym person who lifts while doing some occasional jogs/sprints/stair steppers, then these would be perfect for you. I’m not sure I would pay $180 for them. I got them at a much lower price from my local Nordstrom Rack.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

product_meta.title: ASICS - Mens Gel-Quantum Infinity Shoes
product_meta.description: The men's GEL-QUANTUM INFINITY sportstyle shoe blends a contemporary model and technology. This shoe, infuses sport into a ultra modern look, pulling inspiration from the iconic GEL technology cushioning and the authenticity of its design. The distinctive design and coloring flows throughout the shoe to give you the distinguishable style you've been looking for. A one-piece seamless upper wraps the foot exceptionally well for a custom feel. This upper material works with the fulll-length 360 degrees of GEL technology cushioning to produce unparalleled comfort. The GEL–QUANTUM INFINITY sportstyle shoe blends bold design and innovative performance to take you wherever you need to go. Weight: 13.76. Heel Height: 21mm. Forefoot Height: 14mm.
feature_bullets: Rearfoot and Forefoot GEL Technology Cushioning System - Attenuates shock during impact and toe-off phases, and allows movement in multiple planes as the foot transitions through the gait cycle.

Ortholite Lasting - This lasting material features plush underfoot comfort while providing excellent moisture management and a high level of breathability (Ortholite is a registered trademark of ATP Manufacturing LLC.)
Ortholite Sockliner - Moisture management (Ortholite is a registered trademark of ATP Manufacturing LLC).
